titleStmt.title: National Library of Sweden, A 141
titleStmt.sponsor: Medieval Latin Manuscripts in the National Library: Cataloguing and Digitization
titleStmt.funder: Riksbankens jubileumsfond – The Swedish Foundation for Humanities and Social Sciences

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

msDesc.head: The Epistles of Paul with commentary

supportDesc.foliation: Foliated in pencil by a modern hand. Secundo folio: Romani sunt partes

collation.formula: 1(10, leaf missing at the end), 2-14(8), 15(8+3, 3 leaves added at the end)

p.note: Note in black ink top of page: Kgl Bibl. 1734 års Kat no 12. Theol. in fol.. Middle of the page in black ink: Epistulae sancti Pauli Apostoli cum Commentariis et glossis. Below which in pencil: Från S.t Legers kapell i Loudun (nvn? Poitiers) (kapellet tilhörde grefvarnas af anjou slott; är nu museum).
A small envelope attached to the pastedown in the lower outer corner. The envelope contains parts of an endband in blue yarn.

binding.p: Parchment cover without decoration. The original spine has been removed and then mounted on a support of thick paper. Traces of darker leather on the spine. Top of spine: 12 and underneath Epistolae Pauli Lat. in dark ink. Bottom of spine: A 141 in gold and above this remains of an illeggible label. Stitching visible on .

history.provenance: According to a note on the manuscript belonged to a chapel dedicated to Saint Legier (Leodeger) in a castle in Loudun.
Listed as "Trettionde Skåpet - Andra Raden. no 12" in...
In the catalogue from 1734, "teol. in fol.": "Epistolae Pauli Lat."
J. Jachesius's catalogue from after the fire: "nr 110".
Brought to Sweden by Queen Christina and remained in the royal castle after her abdication. Listed in Vossius's catalogue, U 202:1, p. 78 as: S. Pauli, Epistolae, Latine cum glossis, Membrana.

msItem.title: Epistles of Paul with preface
msItem.explicit: ...Salutant uos de italia gratia cum omnibus uobis amen

msItem.title: Extracts from De Penitentia Salomonis, Augustine's De nuptiis et concupiscentia, and scattered Bible glosses
msItem.explicit: ...que per adam intrauit in mundum hoc qui non credit infelis est.

msItem.title: Commentary on the preface
msItem.explicit: ...aut quolibet denique liniamenta nanua? corrumpente medicamine.

msItem.title: Commentary on Romans
msItem.incipit: Prima ponitur quia primum gradum erroris scilicet superbiam destruit...
msItem.explicit: Cui si auferas cui absoluta est lectio beatus augustinus dicit apponi et tractus quomodo debet accipi

msItem.title: on First Corinthians
msItem.incipit: Chorinthi sunt achaici Hii ab ipso paulo conuersi sunt...
msItem.explicit: Maranatha magus sirum est quam ebreum tamen etsi ex confinio utrarumque linguarum aliquid et hebreum sonet et interpretatur deus noster uenit.

msItem.title: on Second Corinthians
msItem.incipit: Quibusdam chorintiorum per primam epistulam correctis...
msItem.explicit: Spiritus communis patri et filio uel ita spiritus sit uobiscum ut comunicet et conferat uobis gratiam christi et caritatem dei quod est sit tota trinitas uobiscum dans gratias de commissis et caritatem per spiritum.

msItem.title: on Galatians
msItem.incipit: Galathe sunt greci hii ab apostolo ueritatem acceperant...

msItem.title: on Ephesians
msItem.incipit: Ephesi sunt asiani hi per paulum confirmati in fide...
msItem.explicit: Ad similitudinem sponse que non admittit corruptionem.

msItem.title: on Philippians
msItem.incipit: Philipenses sunt macedones hi paulo per epaphroditum aliquam sub-am romam miserant...
msItem.explicit: Impleat desiderium non in terrenis sed in gloria uel gloria christi implere desideria suorum

msItem.title: on Colossians
msItem.incipit: Colosenses sunt asiani quibus non ipse apostolus predicauit sed eius discipuli archippus et epaphras...
msItem.explicit: Prepositum eorum per eos commonet ut qui regendam ecclesiam eorum accepit sit sollicitus de eis plebis autem? causa scribitur epistula et ideo non ad rectorem deitinatur.

msItem.title: on First Thessalonians
msItem.incipit: Thessalonicenses sunt macedones qui facile ab apostolo conuersi...

msItem.title: on Second Thessalonians
msItem.incipit: Orta grauiori tribulatione item monet patientiam ostendens iustum dei iudicium...
msItem.explicit: Vel per epistulam nostram hoc notate nobis.

msItem.title: on First Timothy
msItem.incipit: IEPX? Timotheus iste fuit filius mulieris fidelis patre gentili...
msItem.explicit: Prohanas ut an potasis? que uox se habet ad personam et ad substantiam

msItem.title: on Second Timothy
msItem.incipit: Paulus iam a mundo transiturus item scribit a roma timotheo...
msItem.explicit: Leonis quicum non patet a rusticia remouere uel de uita uult tollere ne aliis prodesset quodque? non potest insultat ei apostolo.

msItem.title: on Titus
msItem.incipit: Tyto relicto crete epistolo? ex simplicitate et humilitate nimis pacienti...
msItem.explicit: sollicite id est necessaria secum adducant.

msItem.title: on Philemon
msItem.incipit: Philomeni familiares litteras misit pro onesimo seruo eius...

msItem.title: on Hebrews
msItem.incipit: Ecclesiis? hebreorum scribit apostole? de eminentia christi...

msItem.title: Freestanding commentary
msItem.incipit: Calix Quia tota humana natura et in anima et corpore erit corrupta...
msItem.explicit: ...Hac autem causa factum uidetur ut scilicet inicio nascentis ecclesie nouis causis existentibus premunire et ut presentia atque oriencia resequaret/-etur? uicia

note.p: and appear to be the old pastedown and endpaper.

Besides the commentary in the margin the main text is also interspersed with interlinear glosses written by the same hand.
is only half as wide as the other leaves.
consists of a small piece of parchment attached to the quire. 122Ar contains the end of the commentary, 122Av contains an addition by a later hand.

collation.catchwords: Catchwords in same ink and script as the main text.

supportDesc.condition: Small holes in the parchment here and there without loss of text, except for on where text has been lost.

layout.note: Main text: Ruling and guidelines in hardpoint. Pricking in margin.

Commentary: The commentary is an intergral part of the page layout with its own guidelines and ruling. When the commentary is at its largest it completley surrounds the main text and has been written on hardpoint ruled lines (two lines for each line of the main text). Leaves with less commentary on them have not always been ruled in this way.

p.note: Note in faded ink of uncertain date: Ca livre Est de leglise de sainct legier du chast- a lodun Legier.

A poem in French written by a late-medieval hand in dark ink. The poem is 7 lines long and signed Johanis + an illegible surname. The poem is repeated two more times below, but without signature. The page also contains same doodles and additional lines of text.
Short note by the same or similar hand as the the rest of the text written vertically in the outer margin.
Several lines of glosses have been erased on the middle of the page. The text is still faintly visible.
Note by later medieval hand, 5 lines of text: O uos causidici...ordo supernus.
Notes and scribblings by one or more late-medieval hand in dark ink. Notes both in Latin and French. A note at the bottom of again states that the book belong to the chapel of Saint Legier.

decoDesc.p: Rubrics in red in top outer corners. Chapter numbers in red Roman numerals in outer margins. Capitals in red or touched with red.
decoDesc.decoNote: Elaborate initals over 8-12 lines in red, blue, green, and yellow for all chapter beginnings. Two initials with added gold. The motives are zoomorph with knotwork and architectural elements (columns, acanthus), sometimes combined and sometimes isolated. Smaller initials over 2-3 lines for prologues. These initals are either of a similar style as the larger initials or simpler in red, green or blue, or blue and yellow.
